content: 5 p2tog turn  when working the heel turn row there will be row 3 sl 1 k4 5 5 ssk turn stitches left over at the end of the row this is normal each decrease uses up one of the stitches at the ends row 4 sl 1 p4 5 5 p2tog turn of the row repeat row 3 & 4 until 6 7 7 sts rem on heel  the decrease is always worked over the gap final heel row rs k6 7 7 heel sts gusset with rs facing using the needle holding the heel sts pick up and knit 6 7 8 stitches along the first side of the heel flap using the slipped sts as a guide with a new needle knit across the 12 13 15 instep sts with a new needle pick up and knit 6 7 8 sts down the second side of the heel flap using the slipped sts as a guide with that same needle k3 4 4 from the heel you re now positioned in the center of the heel this is the new start of round 30 34 38 sts 12 13 15 instep sts grouped together on one needle 18 21 23 on sole if you re on magic loop or 2 circulars these sole stitches will be on the same needle you ll need to place a marker for start of round if you re using dpns the sole stitches will be divided across two needles gusset round 1 k3 3 3 k6 7 8 tbl k12 13 15 instep sts k6 7 8 tbl k to end of round gusset round 2 k to 3 sts before instep k2tog k1 k instep sts k1 ssk k to end of round 2 sts decreased gusset round 3 knit around repeat gusset rounds 2 & 3 2 3 3 more times until 24 26 30 sts rem foot knit even until foot measures 2 75 3 25 4 inches from back of heel toe decrease round k to 3 sts before instep k2tog k1 k1 ssk k to 3 sts before end of instep k2tog k1 k1 ssk k to end of round 4 sts decreased following round knit around repeat the last 2 rounds 1 1 2 more times until 16 18 18 sts rem work the decrease round only twice until 8 10 10 sts rem cut yarn and pull through final sts to secure finishing wash and weave in ends pattern © kate atherley 2014 for personal use only www kateatherley com page 2 photos courtesy jesie ostermiller
